VPR.Q: What is the overall spatial distribution pattern shown in the heatmap?
VPR.A: The heatmap shows a {radial gradient} pattern.

EVJ.Q: What is the global maximum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.96}.

EVJ.Q: What is the global minimum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global minimum heat value is {0.10}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value of label Hospitals on the x-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value of Hospitals on the x-axis is {0.18}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value of label Pharmaceuticals on the x-axis?

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Staffing on the y-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Staffing on the y-axis is {0.16}.

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Insurance on the x-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Insurance on the x-axis is {0.18}.

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Policy on the x-axis?

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Pharmaceuticals and Funding or the cell corresponding to Policy and Regulations?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Pharmaceuticals} and {Funding} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Patient Care and Access or the cell corresponding to Medical Devices and Cost?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Patient Care} and {Access} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Wellness and Cost or the cell corresponding to Hospitals and Staffing?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Wellness} and {Cost} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.66 to 0.76?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Policy, Access), (Policy, Cost), (Research, Funding), (Wellness, Outcomes)}.
